data_table.description: Coroner / Medical Examiner Form, COR. Participants with or without atherosclerosis and cardiovascular disease and involved in the "Atherosclerosis Risk in Communities (ARIC) Cohort" project.

variable.name: CORA03
variable.description: Abstracting for (Cohort or Surveillance). Q3 [Coroner / Medical Examiner Form]

variable.name: CORA05
variable.description: Was an autopsy performed as part of the medical examiner (coroner) investigation? Q5 [Coroner / Medical Examiner Form]

variable.name: CORA06A
variable.description: Did the coroner's report mention any of the following as contributing to or being present at death? Recent myocardial infarction. Q6a [Coroner / Medical Examiner Form]

variable.name: CORA06B
variable.description: Did the coroner's report mention any of the following as contributing to or being present at death? Coronary heart disease/ischemic/atherosclerotic heart disease (other than myocardial infarction [MI]). Q6b [Coroner / Medical Examiner Form]

variable.name: CORA06C
variable.description: Did the coroner's report mention any of the following as contributing to or being present at death? Hypertensive heart disease. Q6c [Coroner / Medical Examiner Form]

variable.name: CORA06D
variable.description: Did the coroner's report mention any of the following as contributing to or being present at death? Valvular heart disease. Q6d [Coroner / Medical Examiner Form]

variable.name: CORA06E
variable.description: Did the coroner's report mention any of the following as contributing to or being present at death? Other heart disease. Q6e [Coroner / Medical Examiner Form]

variable.name: CORA06F
variable.description: Did the coroner's report mention any of the following as contributing to or being present at death? Recent cerebral hemorrhage. Q6f [Coroner / Medical Examiner Form]

variable.name: CORA06G
variable.description: Did the coroner's report mention any of the following as contributing to or being present at death? Recent cerebral infarction. Q6g [Coroner / Medical Examiner Form]

variable.name: CORA06H
variable.description: Did the coroner's report mention any of the following as contributing to or being present at death? Recent cerebral embolus. Q6h [Coroner / Medical Examiner Form]

variable.name: CORA06I
variable.description: Did the coroner's report mention any of the following as contributing to or being present at death? Recent subarachnoid hemorrhage. Q6i [Coroner / Medical Examiner Form]

variable.name: CORA06J
variable.description: Did the coroner's report mention any of the following as contributing to or being present at death? Recent stroke, other or unspecified type. Q6j [Coroner / Medical Examiner Form]

variable.name: CORA07A
variable.description: Was any non cardiac, non stroke finding mentioned as contributing to death? Q7a [Coroner / Medical Examiner Form]

variable.name: CORA07B
variable.description: Kidney disease. Q7b [Coroner / Medical Examiner Form]

variable.name: CORA07C
variable.description: Chronic respiratory disease. Q7c [Coroner / Medical Examiner Form]

variable.name: CORA07D
variable.description: Psychiatric disease or depression. Q7d [Coroner / Medical Examiner Form]

variable.name: CORA07E
variable.description: Alcohol or drug addiction. Q7e [Coroner / Medical Examiner Form]

variable.name: CORA07F
variable.description: Epilepsy. Q7f [Coroner / Medical Examiner Form]

variable.name: CORA07G
variable.description: Liver disease. Q7g [Coroner / Medical Examiner Form]

variable.name: CORA07H
variable.description: Other. Q7h [Coroner / Medical Examiner Form]

variable.name: CORA09
variable.description: Patient had acute symptoms (cardiac or non cardiac) which led to an overt change in activity or to seeking medical care. Q9 [Coroner / Medical Examiner Form]
variable.value: Patient had acute symptoms (cardiac or non cardiac) which led to an overt change in activity or to seeking medical care
Patient died suddenly and was known to have no acute symptoms
Patient was found dead with no documentation of symptoms
Patient had symptoms but they were chronic (without change) or did not lead to a change in activity or seeking medical care

variable.name: CORA10A
variable.description: Within 3 days of death or just before death, did any of the following symptoms begin for the first time? Shortness of breath. Q10a [Coroner / Medical Examiner Form]

variable.name: CORA10B
variable.description: Within 3 days of death or just before death, did any of the following symptoms begin for the first time? Dizziness. Q10b [Coroner / Medical Examiner Form]

variable.name: CORA10C
variable.description: Within 3 days of death or just before death, did any of the following symptoms begin for the first time? Palpitations. Q10c [Coroner / Medical Examiner Form]

variable.name: CORA10D
variable.description: Within 3 days of death or just before death, did any of the following symptoms begin for the first time? Marked or increased fatigue, tiredness or weakness. Q10d [Coroner / Medical Examiner Form]

variable.name: CORA10E
variable.description: Within 3 days of death or just before death, did any of the following symptoms begin for the first time? Headache. Q10e [Coroner / Medical Examiner Form]

variable.name: CORA10F
variable.description: Within 3 days of death or just before death, did any of the following symptoms begin for the first time? Sweating. Q10f [Coroner / Medical Examiner Form]

variable.name: CORA10G
variable.description: Within 3 days of death or just before death, did any of the following symptoms begin for the first time? Paralysis. Q10g [Coroner / Medical Examiner Form]

variable.name: CORA10H
variable.description: Within 3 days of death or just before death, did any of the following symptoms begin for the first time? Loss of speech. Q10h [Coroner / Medical Examiner Form]

variable.name: CORA10I
variable.description: Within 3 days of death or just before death, did any of the following symptoms begin for the first time? Attack of indigestion or nausea or vomiting. Q10i [Coroner / Medical Examiner Form]

variable.name: CORA10J
variable.description: Within 3 days of death or just before death, did any of the following symptoms begin for the first time? Other. Q10j [Coroner / Medical Examiner Form]

variable.name: CORA11A
variable.description: Was there an acute episode(s) of pain or discomfort anywhere in the chest, left arm or shoulder or jaw either just before death or within 72 hours of death? Q11a [Coroner / Medical Examiner Form]

variable.name: CORA11B
variable.description: Pain specifically involved chest. Q11b [Coroner / Medical Examiner Form]

variable.name: CORA11C
variable.description: Did the patient take or was he/she given nitrates at the time of the acute episode? Q11c [Coroner / Medical Examiner Form]

variable.name: CORA11D
variable.description: Was the discomfort or pain diagnosed as having a non-cardiac origin? Q11d [Coroner / Medical Examiner Form]

variable.name: CORA12
variable.description: Place of death. Q12 [Coroner / Medical Examiner Form]

variable.name: CORA13A
variable.description: Anyone witness death? Q13a [Coroner / Medical Examiner Form]

variable.name: CORA13C
variable.description: Relationship of witness to decedent. Q13c [Coroner / Medical Examiner Form]

variable.name: CORA14
variable.description: Time from onset of acute symptoms to death (or time since last known to be alive if no known acute symptoms) (Choose only one). Q14 [Coroner / Medical Examiner Form]

variable.name: CORA15A
variable.description: Is there a history of a myocardial infarction prior to the onset of this event? Q15a [Coroner / Medical Examiner Form]

variable.name: CORA15B
variable.description: Did an MI occur within four weeks prior to this event? Q15b [Coroner / Medical Examiner Form]

variable.name: CORA15C
variable.description: Was the deceased hospitalized for the MI? Q15c [Coroner / Medical Examiner Form]

variable.name: CORA16
variable.description: Is there any history of angina pectoris or coronary insufficiency? Q16 [Coroner / Medical Examiner Form]

variable.name: CORA17
variable.description: Is there a history of any other chronic ischemic heart disease? Q17 [Coroner / Medical Examiner Form]

variable.name: CORA18
variable.description: Is there a history of valvular disease or cardiomyopathy? Q18 [Coroner / Medical Examiner Form]

variable.name: CORA19
variable.description: Is there a history of coronary bypass surgery prior to this event? Q19 [Coroner / Medical Examiner Form]

variable.name: CORA20
variable.description: Is there a history of coronary angioplasty prior to this event? Q20 [Coroner / Medical Examiner Form]

variable.name: CORA21A
variable.description: Is there a history of stroke prior to this event? Q21a [Coroner / Medical Examiner Form]

variable.name: CORA21B
variable.description: Did a stroke occur within four weeks prior to this event? Q21b [Coroner / Medical Examiner Form]

variable.name: CORA22
variable.description: Is there a history of hypertension (high blood pressure) prior to this event? Q22 [Coroner / Medical Examiner Form]

variable.name: CORA22A
variable.description: Is there a history of diabetes? Q22a [Coroner / Medical Examiner Form]

variable.name: CORA22B
variable.description: Is there a history of smoking? Q22b [Coroner / Medical Examiner Form]

variable.name: CORA23A
variable.description: Was the decedent taking any of the following medications as an outpatient within the four weeks prior to death? Nitrates? Q23a [Coroner / Medical Examiner Form]

variable.name: CORA23B
variable.description: Was the decedent taking any of the following medications as an outpatient within the four weeks prior to death? Calcium channel blockers. 23b [Coroner / Medical Examiner Form]

variable.name: CORA23C
variable.description: Was the decedent taking any of the following medications as an outpatient within the four weeks prior to death? Beta-blockers. Q23c [Coroner / Medical Examiner Form]

variable.name: CORA23D
variable.description: Was the decedent taking any of the following medications as an outpatient within the four weeks prior to death? Digitalis. Q23d [Coroner / Medical Examiner Form]

variable.name: CORA23E
variable.description: Was the decedent taking any of the following medications as an outpatient within the four weeks prior to death? ACE or angiotensin II inhibitors. Q23e [Coroner / Medical Examiner Form]

variable.name: CORA23F
variable.description: Was the decedent taking any of the following medications as an outpatient within the four weeks prior to death? Aspirin. Q23f [Coroner / Medical Examiner Form]

variable.name: CORAFLAG
variable.description: =1 if CORA (or later ver) is present [Coroner / Medical Examiner Form]

variable.name: FORMVER
variable.description: Form version

variable.name: CORA01_DAYS
variable.description: Date of death-days from exam 1

variable.name: GWAS_ID
variable.description: ARIC occurrence ID
